title: "How changes the students' debts?"
categories: [tidytuesday, code, analysis]
date: 2020-07-20
toc: true
---



Using the `tidytuesdayR` package this task is easy:


::: {.cell hash='wealth_debt_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_9908e3bd057d13137913b2c40b3ffeb9'}

```{.r .cell-code}
data <-  tidytuesdayR::tt_load(2021, week = 7)
```

```{.r .cell-code}
student_debt <- data$student_debt
```
:::

::: {.cell hash='wealth_debt_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_e27851f84715cacebabe4c68d3d98f43'}

```{.r .cell-code}
head(student_debt) |> knitr::kable()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
| year|race     | loan_debt| loan_debt_pct|
|----:|:--------|---------:|-------------:|
| 2016|White    | 11108.410|     0.3367511|
| 2016|Black    | 14224.770|     0.4183588|
| 2016|Hispanic |  7493.999|     0.2189689|
| 2013|White    |  8363.605|     0.2845555|
| 2013|Black    | 10302.660|     0.4122773|
| 2013|Hispanic |  3177.410|     0.1570289|
:::
:::


# Students debts over time


::: {.cell hash='wealth_debt_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_edd0e38422f5f7ecaa4ab4e543af1f2a'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(ggplot2)
library(ggprism)
student_debt |>
  ggplot(aes(year, loan_debt, color = race)) +
  geom_line() +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    legend.title = element_blank(),
    axis.line = element_line(color = "#000000"),
    axis.ticks = element_line(color = "#000000"),
    panel.grid = element_line(color = "#DDDDDD", linetype = "dotted") # Soft gray
  ) +
  labs(
    x = "",
    y = "Loan debt (US)"
  ) +
  scale_x_continuous(guide = "prism_offset_minor", limits = c(1990,2015)) +
  scale_y_continuous(guide = "prism_offset_minor", limits = c(1000, 10000)) 
```
